description.title: Weekly Goals
description.description: Achieve consistent accuracy above 85% in prioritized Reading & Writing and Math skills, steadily reduce repeat errors by identifying and correcting weak patterns, demonstrate improved reasoning through tackling the most challenging question types, maintain composure and confidence under timed, full-length test conditions, and minimize score variance by stabilizing pacing and strategy execution.

description.title: Reading & Writing
description.description: Transitions, Text Structure and Purpose, Command of Evidence - Quantitative, Rhetorical Synthesis, Cross-text Connections

description.title: Math
description.description: Linear functions, Linear equations in one variable, Lines, angles, and triangles, Equivalent expressions

description.Transitions: Engage in targeted sentence-combining exercises where you must select and insert the most appropriate transition to clarify logical relationships, followed by self-explanation of why each transition fits the context to deepen understanding and avoid overuse.
description.Text Structure and Purpose: Analyze timed SAT passages by outlining paragraph structures and annotating signal words, then write brief summaries identifying author purpose to build speed and mastery of complex question types under pressure.
description.Command of Evidence - Quantitative: Practice with SAT-style passages containing embedded graphs and tables, focusing on locating precise numerical evidence to support claims, using stepwise elimination of distractors and paraphrasing data to confirm comprehension within timed drills.
description.Rhetorical Synthesis: Complete synthesis exercises that require comparing multiple short passages, identifying rhetorical appeals and relationships, and writing concise paragraphs that integrate evidence with clear transitions, emphasizing clarity and logical flow under timed conditions.
description.Cross-text Connections: Work on paired passage sets where you identify agreements, contradictions, and author purposes, using graphic organizers to map relationships, followed by answering synthesis questions that demand integration of ideas across texts with accuracy and speed.

description.Linear functions: Solve complex word problems by translating scenarios into linear equations, explicitly identifying slope and intercept, then graphing and interpreting results, all within timed practice sets to build fluency and speed.
description.Linear equations in one variable: Master multi-step linear equations and inequalities by systematically isolating variables, carefully applying inverse operations, and verifying solutions through substitution, emphasizing accuracy under timed conditions.
description.Lines, angles, and triangles: Practice high-difficulty geometry problems involving congruence, similarity, and angle relationships by drawing detailed diagrams, labeling knowns and unknowns, and writing stepwise justifications to reinforce conceptual clarity and speed.
description.Equivalent expressions: Engage in exercises that require isolating variables in multi-step algebraic expressions and formulas, focusing on clear notation and stepwise manipulation, followed by verification of results to ensure precision and confidence.

description.title: Weekly Structure
description.description: Each weekday begins with focused dual-skill practice pairing one Math and one Reading & Writing skill, starting Monday and Tuesday with the weakest skills to build foundational strength, midweek sessions target moderate skills to maintain momentum, Fridays are dedicated to comprehensive review and error analysis to consolidate learning, Saturdays involve two full-length SAT practice tests under timed conditions emphasizing accuracy and speed optimization with detailed post-test reflection, and Sundays serve as a Flex Day for rest and adaptive activities aligned with maintaining balance and sustainable progress.

description.title: Flex Day Activities
description.description: Engage in low-pressure reflection by reviewing errors from the week to identify patterns without judgment, experiment with new study tools or techniques such as digital flashcards or timed apps to refresh engagement, participate in mixed-skill micro-challenges with peers slightly above your intensity level to gently push boundaries, incorporate mindfulness or light physical activity like walking or yoga to restore mental equilibrium, and set clear, achievable goals for the upcoming week to maintain steady, balanced progress without sacrificing inner calm.
